physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. In the center of the photograph, there is a bride and groom in a suit and wedding dress, standing in the middle of a walkway. The bride is holding a bouquet of flowers. Behind them, there are two men in suits. They are standing in front of a house. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of bride and groom outside of building
